channel.title: Demergence
channel.itunes:author: Jordan Last @lastmjs
channel.description: Deep discussions about the Internet Computer, DFINITY, Ethereum, blockchain, and more

item.title: Demergence 7 - 2022 Internet Computer and Ethereum Outlook
item.description:
***Make sure to download the episode. There is currently a known bug with IC asset canisters causing streaming issues***
Jordan Last, Bob Bodily, and the community discuss the outlook for the Internet Computer and Ethereum into this current year of 2022.
Opening song cut from Something Elated: https://freemusicarchive.org/music/Broke_For_Free/Something_EP/Broke_For_Free_-_Something_EP_-_05_Something_Elated By Broke For Free: http://brokeforfree.com Licensed under an Attribution 3.0 United States License: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/us

item.title: Demergence Episode 6 - Log Voting on the IC
item.description:
***Make sure to download the episode. There is currently a known bug with IC asset canisters causing streaming issues***
Jordan Last, Ryan Horne, and the community discuss an idea we are calling logarithmic voting for the Internet Computer.
Proposal to include cycle_dao and ICDevs as default follow-target neurons to the NNS: https://forum.dfinity.org/t/proposal-to-include-cycle-dao-icdevs-as-default-follow-target-neurons-to-the-nns/9363
Opening song cut from Something Elated: https://freemusicarchive.org/music/Broke_For_Free/Something_EP/Broke_For_Free_-_Something_EP_-_05_Something_Elated By Broke For Free: http://brokeforfree.com Licensed under an Attribution 3.0 United States License: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/us

item.title: Demergence Episode 5 - Deterministic vs Optimistic Decentralization
item.description:
***Make sure to download the episode. There is currently a known bug with IC asset canisters causing streaming issues***
I discuss the idea of deterministic decentralization as implemented by the Internet Computer and Chainlink. I contrast that with what I call optimistic decentralization as implemented by Bitcoin, Ethereum, and most other blockchains.
Opening song cut from Something Elated: https://freemusicarchive.org/music/Broke_For_Free/Something_EP/Broke_For_Free_-_Something_EP_-_05_Something_Elated By Broke For Free: http://brokeforfree.com Licensed under an Attribution 3.0 United States License: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/us

item.title: Demergence Episode 4 - Existential Threats to the Internet Computer
item.description:
***Make sure to download the episode. There is currently a known bug with IC asset canisters causing streaming issues***
I think these could be existential threats to the Internet Computer's success. Agree? 1. The NNS is unable to decentralize sufficiently 2. Subnets are unable to decentralize sufficiently 3. ICP is declared a security by the SEC 4. Ethereum adopts chain key -> fantastic sharding

item.title: Demergence Episode 3 - Building a database on the Internet Computer
item.description:
***Make sure to download the episode. There is currently a known bug with IC asset canisters causing streaming issues***
I discuss my experience with Sudograph and building a database on the Internet Computer.

item.title: Demergence Episode 2 - The Futures of Ethereum and the Internet Computer
item.description:
***Make sure to download the episode. There is currently a known bug with IC asset canisters causing streaming issues***
Demergence Episode 2! I ramble through the idea of blockchains as protocols, protocol domains, and the decentralization, security, and scalability of Ethereum and the Internet Computer and what that means for their possible futures.

item.title: Demergence Episode 1 - Privacy on the Internet Computer
item.description:
***Make sure to download the episode. There is currently a known bug with IC asset canisters causing streaming issues***
The second episode of Demergence! We discuss privacy on the Internet Computer, diving into the differences between security of data and privacy of data, and what privacy looks like on centralized cloud providers, Ethereum and other blockchains, and the Internet Computer.
